Name: N/D
Job Title: Hd of Commercial DIO for Operations
Job/Team Function: Head of Commercial DIO has overall responsibility to CE DIO for the efficient and effective conduct of the commercial function which enables the delivery of DIO outputs. The post holder is accountable for all DIO contractual arrangements and must work closely with the Executive Committee of the Infrastructure Board (ECIB) and Operating Committee of Infrastructure Board (OCIB) members to develop and deliver DIO outputs. Responsible to the MoD Commercial Process Owner for ensuring that DIO commercial processes are undertaken wholly in accordance with MoD policy. Responsible for supporting Director Corporate Services and Director Commercial Services in achieving MoD commercial objectives. The Head of Commercial is a member of the Executive Committee of the Infrastructure Board (ECIB).

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Secretariat Defence Infrastructure Organisation
Job/Team Function: Handles all Ministerial Business for the DIO, including drafting answers to Parliamentary Questions and Ministerial Correspondence and responding to Freedom of Information requests. Manages all the DIO senior committees, and provides a comprehensive performance and risk management analysis, including Health and Safety, to those committees and the Department. Required to deliver leadership to the DIO on a range of topics including Security and Business Continuity. Handles all media and communications activity for the DIO.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Chief Finance Officer Defence Infrastructure Organisation
Job/Team Function: The CFO has a key role in the Capability and Planning activity within the TLB, responsible for all aspects of the DIOs Financial Planning and Reporting. Responsible for ensuring that all TLB Plans are affordable and value for money and ensuring that business is conducted within the terms laid down within HMTs Managing Public Money, including compliance with centrally mandated processes and controls. he CFO is responsible for ensuring that delegations to the TLB are discharged correctly, and oversees scrutiny over the exercising of delegated authority to approve certain investment decisions. Te CFO is responsible for ensuring that there is a system of effective corporate governance and internal controls in place (Control Framework), the integrity of financial systems and the achievement of efficiency and providing assurance over those controls. he CFO is a full member of the of the Defence Infrastructure Board (DIB), Executive Committee of the Infrastructure Board (ECIB), chairs the DIO Investment Appraisals Committee (IAC) and is the DIOs appointed Senior Finance Office.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head Strategic Asset Management and Programming Team
Job/Team Function: The Head of Strategic Asset Management (SAM) is responsible for the identification, pan-MOD, of infrastructure rationalisation opportunities, the improvement of utilisation, increase of commercialisation of infrastructure assets and driving down the overall cost of ownership of the estate. Accountable for the DIO TLB Strategy and Command Plan, infrastructure related policy and to support CE DIO as MODs Sustainable Development Process Owner.

Name: Mr Andrew Manley
Job/Team Function: Strategic management of the military estate as a whole, optimising investment and supporting military capability to best effect through the management and delivery of property, infrastructure and related services to all of Defence. Delivery of an estate which is of the right quality and size to efficiently and effectively meet military requirements. Delivery of significant running cost reductions, improved estate utilisation, further estate rationalisation and exploration of commercialisation opportunities in line with the Strategic Defence and Security Review (SDSR), Public Accounts Committee (PAC) and Defence Reform recommendations. Provision of infrastructure support to enable success in Afghanistan and other operational standing commitments. Delivery of coherent and affordable infrastructure solutions to meet Defence needs for the Directed Force, Interim Force 2015, Future Force 2020 and Future Reserves 2020. Provision of and effective, efficient, safe, legal, and sustainable Infrastructure to Defence. The job is tasked with ongoing delivery of the Estate and services. In addition the role oversees a major transformation of estate management including implementation of DIOs operating model together with Projects NGEC (Hard FM) and Hestia (Soft FM) to transform delivery. Procurement of a possible Strategic Business Partner is included in the challenges. The role additionally oversees delivery of the MODs Footprint Strategy and is SRO for the Rebasing programme.

Job/Team Function: To provide direction and support to all divisional activities in accordance with DGART's intent and in conjunction with COS.

Name: N/D

It will have regard to the current and future utilisation of the estate and the funding and phasing of transition against the delivery of both MOD and wider Government policy and targets.

The overall vision is to ensure that the Army is housed in modern infrastructure on the home base, where soldiers and their families want to live and work.

Job Title: Director Strategic Asset Management and Programming Team
Job/Team Function: The Director Strategic Asset Management and Programme Team requires a full understanding of Military capability within the Navy, Land, Air and Joint Force Command context in order to fully engage with the appropriate Departmental, pan Government and Industry elements to ensure that the entirety of the Operational requirement for these areas is captured, tested, planned for and programmed. As the Infra DLOD Military specialist, advises on the infrastructure DLOD requirements. Leads the Defence strategic infrastructure and asset management planning and programming, and associated strategy/policy in the context of the effective utilisation, rationalisation and commercialisation of Defence infrastructure. Director SAPT drives the Footprint Strategy to determine basing solutions for FF2020, in the context of the need to identify the right-sized, affordable and sustainable estate to meet operational outputs. Requires an in-depth appreciation of the impact that such decisions will have on both the Operational capability and the moral component. Director Strategic Asset Management and Programme Team is a member of the Defence Infrastructure Board (DIB), Executive Committee of Infrastructure Board (ECIB) and the DIO Investment Approvals Committee.

Name: N/D

Align DIP decision-making with Departmental planning rounds and support appropriate and effective scrutiny mechanisms in support of the DIO IAC. Interface with military chiefs and key stakeholders across the Defence community to understand infrastructure drivers and operational interdependencies to manage associated programme risks and benefit realisation.
